bibl.title: Dispatch from Henry Rider to Frederick W. Seward, May 23, 1864
Despatches from United States Consuls in Sierra Leone, 1858-1906 T-438

div1.p:
U.S. Consulate
Sierra Leone W. C. of Africa
25th August 1875.

The Honorable R. W. Taylor
Comptroller Treasury Dept
First Comptroller Office
Washington D.C.

In reply to your communication dated July 21st a.c. and addressed to T. Rosenbush Esqre, Late U.S. Vice Commercial Agent for this place I respectfully beg to state that this Official having died in 1869 and no entries having been made (aw for as I can find out) conductive to rectify and clear up the various Consular transactions referred to in your communication - no explanations can be given from this office with regard to the adjustment of the Relief Account from May 15, 1868 to June 30, 1869.

Regretting very much that I cannot be of any service in this
matter.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your most obedt servant
W H Randall
U.S. Consul.
